events.name: 3D Mechanical Design Industry Seminar
events.description:
Are you aware of what your competitors are doing to: 
  
1. Get to Market Faster 
2. Increase Customer Satisfaction 
3. Reduce Manufacturing Costs 
4. Create Innovative Products  
    
  
Join us to find out how YOU can: 
  
1. Get to Market Faster  


Reduce rework | Reuse design data | Improve collaboration 


  
2. Increase Customer Satisfaction  


Improve product design quality | Reduce warranty claims | Optimize product performance 


  
3. Reduce Manufacturing Costs  


Evaluate product manufacturability | Reduce cost during product design stage


   
4. Create Innovative Products  


Share one interoperable tool across multi disciplines | Collaborate more efficiently


  
      
WHO SHOULD ATTEND 
Management level ie. Engineering Head, IT Department Head, Chief Technical Officer, Business Owners who would like to know more about industry trends and an overview on the 3D Mechanical Design solutions and services that ATE provides to empower local companies to meet engineering challenges. 
   
AGENDA 
09:30am: Getting to Know ATE 
10:00am: SolidWorks Solution Overview 
10:45am: Government Funding Options 
11:00am: Technical Process Flow: How to Get to Market Faster  
12:00pm: Q&A  
  
EVENT FEE 
Complimentary 
   
WHEN 
January 16, 2015 09:30am - 12:30pm 
   
WHERE 
ATE Training Centre 
31 Kaki Bukit Road 3 
Techlink #05-09 
Singapore 417818     FOR MORE INFORMATION 
Contact Jiayi at 6747 0502 
Email jiayi.wu@ateworks.net 
Visit www.ateworks.net 
   
ONLY 10 SLOTS AVAILABLE. 
REGISTER NOW!

events.name: Simulation 101: Achieve Maximum Cost Savings on Physical Prototyping by Testing Your Models Digitally
events.description:
Are you required to:  


Validate product performance and safety while you design?


Investigate the impact of a moving liquid or gas on product performance?


Calculate temperate distribution within a solid structure?


    
Join us to find out about Simulation 101:  


Calculate stresses and deformations of parts and assemblies due to internal / external loads


Calculate fluid flow and heat transfer forces


Understand more about finite element analysis (FEA)


  
EVENT TITLE 
Simulation 101: Achieve Maximum Cost Savings on Physical Prototyping By Testing Your Models Digitally 
  
  
WHO SHOULD ATTEND 
Engineering Analysts, Product Engineers, Simulation Engineers, Middle Management and other Engineers who want to learn about SolidWorks Simulation and how ATE will value add in meeting engineering challenges. 
   
AGENDA 
02:00pm: Simulation 101: How to Achieve Maximum Cost Savings? 
03:00pm: Painpoints of Engineers & Business Owners 
03:30pm: Hands-On Walkthrough 
04:30pm: Funding Options to Defray Costs  
04:40pm: Q&A

events.name: Friday Hacks #84 - Getting a sip of Elixir
events.description: Welcome back! For the first Friday Hacks of the semester, we have Benjamin Tan, Software Engineer at Neo Innovation, Inc., sharing about a new programming language named Elixir, and what interesting things can be done with it. - Talk description from the speaker: "Lately, I've been consumed with learning and writing about Elixir, functional programming language built on top of the Erlang VM. In this talk, I will give a quick walkthrough of the language. Then, in short examples, I will demonstrate concepts such as concurrency, fault tolerance and distribution – areas where Elixir shines. It will be a fun ride!" - Speaker profile Benjamin Tan is a software engineer at Neo Innovation, Inc, an author, and a speaker. He has spoken at major conferences such as RubyConf in San Diego, GeekCamp SG and RedDotRubyConf Singapore. He's also an open source contributor working with projects like Rails, Elixir, Spree and the Phoenix Framework. Recently, he has been working on The Little Elixir Guidebook (http://www.exotpbook.com), which will be published in the near future. Some of his writings can be found at http://www.sitepoint.com/author/btan/. More about him can be found at http://benjamintan.io, or on twitter at @bentanweihao
events.location: LT15, AS6, National University of Singapore
